memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< std::vector< double > > &dataPointsOfIndependentVariables, const std::shared_ptr< SurfaceGeometry > inputVehicleSurface, const std::vector< int > &numberOfLines, const std::vector< int > &numberOfPoints, const std::vector< bool > &invertOrders, const std::vector< std::vector< int > > &selectedMethods, const double referenceArea, const double referenceLength, const Eigen::Vector3d &momentReferencePoint, const bool savePressureCoefficients=false)
memberdef.name: HypersonicLocalInclinationAnalysis

briefdescription.para: Default constructor.

detaileddescription.para:
Default constructor of class, specified vehicle geometry, discretization properties, independent variable ranges, reference values and local inclination methods that are to be used
dataPointsOfIndependentVariables
Vector of vector, with each subvector containing the data points of each of the independent variables for the coefficient generation. The physical meaning of each of the three independent variables is: 0 = mach numner, 1 = angle of attack, 2 = angle of sideslip. Each of the subvectors must be sorted in ascending order.
inputVehicleSurface
Vehicle surface geometry for which the coefficients are to be determined.
numberOfLines
Number of discretization points in the first independent surface variable of each of the subparts of inputVehicleSurface.
numberOfPoints
Number of discretization points in the second independent surface variable of each of the subparts of inputVehicleSurface.
invertOrders
Booleans to denote whether the surface normals of the panels of each discretized inputVehicleSurface subpart are to be inverted (i.e. inward-facing->outward facing or vice versa)
selectedMethods
Array of selected local inclination methods, the first index represents compression/expansion, the second index denotes the vehicle part index. The value for each separate method can be found in the updateCompressionPressures and updateExpansionPressures functions, respectively.
referenceArea
Reference area used to non-dimensionalize aerodynamic forces and moments.
referenceLength
Reference length used to non-dimensionalize aerodynamic moments.
momentReferencePoint
Reference point wrt which aerodynamic moments are calculated.
savePressureCoefficients
Boolean denoting whether to save the pressure coefficients that are computed to files

briefdescription.para: Default destructor.

detaileddescription.para: Default destructor.

briefdescription.para: Get aerodynamic coefficients.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns aerodynamic coefficients. The physical meaning of each of the three independent variables is: 0 = mach number, 1 = angle of attack, 2 = angle of sideslip.
independentVariables
Array of values of independent variable indices in dataPointsOfIndependentVariables_.
vector of coefficients at specified independent variable indices.

briefdescription.para: Determine inclination angles of panels on a given part.

detaileddescription.para: Determines the inclination angle of panels on a single part.

Determines panel inclinations for all panels on all parts for given attitude. Outward pointing surface-normals are assumed!
angleOfAttack
Angle of attack at which to determine inclination angles.
angleOfSideslip
Angle of sideslip at which to determine inclination angles.

briefdescription.para: Generate aerodynamic database.

detaileddescription.para: Generates aerodynamic database. Settings of geometry, reference quantities, database point settings and analysis methods should have been set previously.

briefdescription.para: Generate aerodynamic coefficients at a single set of independent variables.

detaileddescription.para:
Generates aerodynamic coefficients at a single set of independent variables. Determines values and sets corresponding entry in vehicleCoefficients_ array.
independentVariableIndices
Array of indices from lists of Mach number, angle of attack and angle of sideslip points at which to perform analysis.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int partNumber, const boost::array< int, 3 > independentVariableIndices)
memberdef.name: determinePartCoefficients

briefdescription.para: Determine aerodynamic coefficients for a single LaWGS part.

detaileddescription.para: Determine aerodynamic coefficients of a single vehicle part.

Determines aerodynamic coefficients for a single LaWGS part, calls determinepressureCoefficient_ function for given vehicle part.
partNumber
Index from vehicleParts_ array for which to determine coefficients.
independentVariableIndices
Array of indices of independent variables.
Force and moment coefficients for requested vehicle part.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int partNumber, const boost::array< int, 3 > independentVariableIndices)
memberdef.name: determinePressureCoefficients

briefdescription.para: Determine pressure coefficients on a given part.

detaileddescription.para: Determine the pressure coefficients on a single vehicle part.

Determines pressure coefficients on a single vehicle part. Calls the updateExpansionPressures and updateCompressionPressures for given vehicle part.
partNumber
Index from vehicleParts_ array for which to determine coefficients.
independentVariableIndices
Array of indices of independent variables.

briefdescription.para: Determine force coefficients of a part.

detaileddescription.para: Determine force coefficients from pressure coefficients.

Sums the pressure coefficients of given part and determines force coefficients from it by non-dimensionalization with reference area.
partNumber
Index from vehicleParts_ array for which determine coefficients.
Force coefficients for requested vehicle part.

briefdescription.para: Determine moment coefficients of a part.

detaileddescription.para: Determine moment coefficients from pressure coefficients.

Determines the moment coefficients of a given part by summing the contributions of all panels on the part. Moment arms are taken from panel centroid to momentReferencePoint. Non- dimensionalization is performed by product of referenceLength and referenceArea.
partNumber
Index from vehicleParts_ array for which to determine coefficients.
Moment coefficients for requested vehicle part.

briefdescription.para: Determine the compression pressure coefficients of a given part.

detaileddescription.para: Determine compression pressure coefficients on all parts.

Sets the values of pressureCoefficient_ on given part and at given Mach number for which inclination > 0.
machNumber
Mach number at which to perform analysis.
partNumber
of part from vehicleParts_ which is to be analyzed.

briefdescription.para: Determine the expansion pressure coefficients of a given part.

detaileddescription.para: Determines expansion pressure coefficients on all parts.

Determine the values of pressureCoefficient_ on given part and at given Mach number for which inclination <= 0.
machNumber
Mach number at which to perform analysis.
partNumber
of part from vehicleParts_ which is to be analyzed.

briefdescription.para: Class for inviscid hypersonic aerodynamic analysis using local inclination methods.

detaileddescription.para: Class for inviscid hypersonic aerodynamic analysis using local inclination methods. These methods assume that the local pressure on the vehicle is only dependent on the local inclination angle w.r.t. the freestream flow and freestream conditions, such as Mach number and ratio of specific heats. All aerodynamic coefficients can be calculated using the generateCoefficients function, or on an as needed basis by using the getAerodynamicCoefficientsDataPoint function. Note that during the panel inclination determination process, a geometry with outward surface-normals is assumed. The resulting coefficients are expressed in the same reference frame as that of the input geometry.
